body.p:
Stanford. Ky.
May 27" 1865
Governor Bramlett,
Sir: --

I seat myself this evening to find out if I cannot get my son released from Capt Bridgewaters Company My husband is in the army, and has been far upwards of a year, and I am left alone with a large family on my hands with no one to help me, unless I can get my son home He Should never have been enlisted, as he is not 18 years old, and was all that I had left
to help support me and my family. His name is Tom Ends and belongs to Co, "A," of Bridgewaters command, will you please give your attention to his case the first opportunity and you will receive the prayers and blessin of a suffering Mother. Please answer as soon as possible, and let me know what you will do

and I remain Very Respectfully
Lucy Ann Ends
Stanford
Kentucky

Stanford Ky.
May 27" 1865
Ends Lucy Ann
Gov
asks that her son Tom Ends Co "A" Bridgewater Command be discharged he is not 18" years old
Let her know that her son will be discharged upon affidavit that he is not 18" years --

L B No 13 -- 1865 P. 265
Recd A. G. O. June 21" 1865
